is, you guys make any project You will see the string being used in some way or the other Today I will tell you about string slicing And I will tell you some more interesting things about string Which will make it easier for you to play with string Let's go to the computer screen and let's get started Intro Music So today we are going to see again Our old topic which was strings So first of all I will open this wrapper in my strings And today we are going to see how string slicing is done Let's say we have a string named Harry And it is made of 5 characters H, A, R, R, Y Let's say you want to access from R to Y Or if you don't like this example Let's say I gave you a string which has 5 names Let me quickly come to my wrapper and explain to you what I am talking about Let's say I have a name I will give you names here H, A, R, R, Y, S, H, U, B, H, A, M In fact I will name it Let's say I have comma separated names I want only Harry So I can do something like this Print names And after this I want to take 5 characters from the beginning How will I take the initial 5 characters First of all I will specify the starting index And after this I will specify the ending index I will say that I start from the starting index Index starts from 0 by the way Whenever we count something in our life, we start from 1 If we count the fingers of the hand, then we start from 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 Whatever we do, the counting starts from 1 In programming, whatever you do, starting from 0 is not 1 Because most of the programming languages start from 0 This is clear now Now what I did is I started counting from 0 And what I will do here is I will write 6 Why did I write 6, I want 5 characters from the beginning So why did I write 6 I will write 5, so I will get 5 characters So I will get from 0 to 4 If you hover like this So see here this replete tells you a lot But now leaving all these things, I will tell you how it works This is from 0 to n-1 The value of n is 5 here It prints you the indices Like it did 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 It did not do 5, this thing is to be remembered Now I have written such an interesting tutorial for you See here, length of a string We can find the length of a string using length function Before all this, I would like to tell you If you want to find the length of any string Like this string named names I want the length of this So I will use length function and put the string in it 13 came, count it 2, 2, 4, 2, 6, 2, 8, 2, 10, 2, 12, and 1, 13 13 characters came here So you can find the length like this I have given an example here, we can try it out Mango is a 5 character word 5 letter word So we have 5 letters in mango So mango is a 5 letter word Now string is basically an array It is a sequence of characters We saw this in the last video We can access any element of this Now see here, I will explain slicing to you Leave this now and listen to me I have fruit is equal to mango I have printed len1 here Or mango len I can keep anything, I can keep anything I have kept mango len So I will get 5 prints here Now I want to get the initial two characters of fruit So I will write fruit And after that I will write print fruit And I will put this square bracket notation Make sure you don't use parenthesis We use parenthesis for sections But for slicing we use square brackets Square brackets are on your keyboard They are on the right side of P You can see it in your keyboard And from 0 to Let's say I write up to 4 So I will get 4 characters at the beginning I am basically saying this line Give zeroth index, first index Give second index Give third index You will not see the fourth index You will not see the fourth index You will see only 0 to 3 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 characters I will run and show you M, A, N, G will be the output What will happen if I don't put 0 I can skip 0 If I don't put 0 Then what will Python do It will automatically put 0 here If I skip it, this is a very good feature of Python Now what will happen if I want to start from 1 I want from index 1 So I will write from 1 to 4 So I will get A, N and G Now see here I got A, N and G But if I write something like this Index and colon and 4 So automatically Python is so smart It will put 0 So it will put 0 here And you will get mang again If I remove 4 here So what will Python do It will put length of fruit What is length of fruit? It is 5, so it will put 5 So if I don't put 5 So I am getting mango And if I put 5, I will get mango So this is how slicing works Now about slicing I want to tell you one more thing Negative slicing If I put minus 1 here I will put 0 here So 0 will come automatically And if I write minus 3 here What will happen I will tell you why it came It is M, A output Why it came So let's understand how Python interprets this The minus 3 Here len of Fruit, this is what Python Interpreter puts automatically Length of fruit, how much is len of fruit? It is 5, we saw it is 5 Len of fruit is 5 And 5 minus 3 is 2 So 0 to 2 means 0 M And then 1 means A 0 is on index M A is on first index So M is printed I will tell you for clarity If I write this Or
